basics.name: Sven Pettersson
basics.label: Senior Python/Django developer + Android Developer
basics.summary: Senior developer with focus in Django/Python/Android/GAE/AWS/Flask. I have a history of working with startups and larger companies around Stockholm. Predominantly mobile apps and backend in Mobile Payments and Fintech. Even though I'm an experienced developer I still love the feeling of seeing the code I was part of dreaming actually working.

work.name: Hemma
work.summary: Employed as Senior Backend Developer. Working primarily with connecting Hemma infrastructure to EDIEL to fetch customers energy consumption. This is done through a Edifact interface with consumers implemented in Python.

work.name: TRMedia
work.summary:
Working as Senior Backend Developer at TR-Media. The main focus is developing new functions and handling support for the backend system connected to the sites that TR-Media publish. Much of the work also involves GCP and handling the cloud platform

The main techniques I'm working with are: Django, Python, Node, GCP and some Java. Also setting up mass testing with Locust.

work.name: Brite
work.summary:
When I joined Brite it was newly founded. I had a contract role and was employed at uBit. The work consisted of taking the idea of the founder and creating it into a product. The product enables customers to clients to easily do transactions to and from bank accounts. Much of the work was scraping and implementing the PSD2 API presented by the different banks. I was heavily involved in creating this solution for the Swedish, Finnish and Dutch market. Much of my work was direct development but also mentoring new developers.

The system used Python/Flask/GCP/Postgres/Node

work.name: uBIT
work.summary: I was employed at uBit as a consultant. My contract and placement was at Brite.

work.name: Scomas AB
work.summary: Scomas is my own company that I have used as a consultant. I was employes as a consultant at Espresso House to rebuild their Android app from scratch and for handling and shutting down the old backend system.

work.name: Espresso House Group (Consultant from Scones ab)
work.summary: I had the possibility to be part of a team creating a new payment / Loyalty system for Espresso House.I worked primarily with writing the new Android app. As I was the sole Android developer I had the possibility to get in all parts of the android app. As I had worked with the previous backend part of my work was also to support and help migrate to the new system.

work.name: LEEROY GROUP AB
work.summary:
The mobile payment system I worked with at Bambora was sold on to Leeroy, I continued working on this system when I left Leeroy, then as a freelance consultant at Espresso House. I got the opportunity to be part of a small team, two developers and two consultants, to continue working on the system. This ment scaling down and prioritizing the customer and to redevelop the system. The system also lay the foundation of the Restaurant applications that Leeroy created. My role became more of a lead developer. Working mainly on Android but also pitching in where needed and organizing the work.

During this period I worked with Python/Django/AWS/Mysql/Android and a lot of work went inte RESTful API development.

work.name: Bambora
work.position: Backend developer / Test manager / Quality Assurance
work.summary:
Django / AWS / Mysql developer. I was hired by the company MobiVending which was merged with several other companies to create Bambora. The main product was a mobile payment system implemented and at a Uppsala Länstrafik, Selecta vending machines and Espresso House. The system was developed in Python/Django and deployed on AWS. I continued working on this system on Leeroy.

During this period I worked with Django/ Python/ Docker/AWS/Mysql

work.name: MSC Konsult AB
work.summary: IT-consultant with competence in Java, Android, PHP and C++.

work.name: Zamsos
work.summary: I was part of a small team developing a mobile payment app. This included developing Android and iOS apps, developing a QR-Code reader to be connected to the Point of sale and creating the backend system I Java. I used a number of different tools during my employment. Among others Android, Iphone, Php, Java and c++. At the same time I was responsible for the Software that the company developed, Zaci. Zaci connected the POS to the card terminal. It also was used as a solution for collecting sales data. The system was in place at H&M, Hemköp and Systembolaget among others.

work.name: Graz Advantage
work.summary:
Develop depository for ﬁnancial securities in the Java Environment
Develop unit tests for a large data warehouse systems focused on the ﬁnancial
market
